item.title: Kim add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "From that time on, the world was hers for the reading. She would never be lonely again, never miss the lack of intimate friends. Books became her friends and there was one for every mood. There was poetry for quiet companionship. There was adventure when she tired of quiet hours. There would be love stories when she came into adolescence and when she wanted to feel a closeness to someone she could read a biography. On that day when she first knew she could read, she made a vow to read one book a day as long as she lived." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Kim add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Because something is significantly wrong with a creature that sacrifices its children's lives to settle its differences. You can spin it any way you like... But in the end, who does it benefit? No one. The truth is, it benefits no one to live in a world where these things happen" -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kim add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Kim add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Kim add a quote by Thomas Fuller
item.description: "Good clothes open all doors." -- Thomas Fuller

item.title: Kim add a quote by Irving Kristol
item.description: "If you believe that no one was ever corrupted by a book, you have also to believe that no one was ever improved by a book." -- Irving Kristol

item.title: Kim add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Kim add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Passion. It lies in all of us. Sleeping... waiting... and though unwanted, unbidden, it will stir... open its jaws and howl. It speaks to us... guides us. Passion rules us all. And we obey. What other choice do we have? Passion is the source of our finest moments. The joy of love... the clarity of hatred... the ecstasy of grief. It hurts sometimes more than we can bear. If we could live without passion, maybe we'd know some kind of peace. But we would be hollow. Empty rooms, shuttered and dank. Without passion, we'd be truly dead." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Scott Westerfield
item.description: "The human heart is a strange vessel. Love and hatred can exist side by side." -- Scott Westerfield

item.title: Kim add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "You see, freedom has a way of destroying things." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Kim add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kim add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "I don't believe in failure, because simply by saying you've failed, you've admitted you attempted. And anyone who attempts is not a failure. Those who truly fail in my eyes are the ones who never try at all. The ones who sit on the couch and whine and moan and wait for the world to change for them." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Kim add a quote by E.L. James
item.description: "Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high." -- E.L. James

item.title: Kim add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Two possibilities exist: either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying." -- Arthur C. Clarke
